com.rexsl.trap
Class SmtpNotifier

java.lang.Object
  com.rexsl.trap.SmtpNotifier
All Implemented Interfaces:
Notifier, Closeable
public final class SmtpNotifier
extends Object

Notifier by SMTP.

Configuration of this notifier is to be done via its URI in web.xml, for example: 

 <servlet>
  <servlet-name>ExceptionTrap</servlet-name>
  <servlet-class>com.rexsl.trap.ExceptionTrap</servlet-class>
  <init-param>
   <param-name>com.rexsl.trap.Notifier</param-name>
   <param-value>
    com.rexsl.trap.SmtpNotifier?to=me@example.com
    &subject=Runtime%20problem%20at%20example%2Ecom
    &from=no-replyexample%2Ecom
   </param-value>
  </init-param>
 </servlet>

All parameters you set as URI query params will be delivered to Java Mail API as explained in javax.mail. The following parameters are expected besides the ones defined in the API: transport, password, subject, to.

You can specify explicit values of parameters or refer us to one of your MANIFEST.MF files, for example: 

 com.rexsl.trap.SmtpNotifier?mail.smtp.host=:My-Host

In this case we will try to find and read My-Host attribute from one of available MANIFEST.MF files (read more in Manifests).

Spaces and any control symbols (new lines, tabs, etc) inside the URI are removed automatically.

We recommend to use SmtpBulkNotifier, which caches messages in a temporary buffer and sends them all together every X seconds/minutes.

Since:
0.3.6
Version:
$Id: SmtpNotifier.java 1758 2012-05-28 14:51:16Z guard $
Author:
Yegor Bugayenko (yegor@rexsl.com)
See Also:
